definition: finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
bar buoy/buoy marking shallows or sandbar
pinyin: qian3 tan1 zhi3 shi4 fu2 biao1

sentences.english: The Console should indicate that both subscribers received a copy of the message.
sentences.chinese: 控制檯應該指示兩個訂戶均收到了該消息的複本。

sentences.english: Sippy and directed by Ramesh Sippy, released in 1975.
sentences.chinese: 播出，並指示由拉梅什風格，發表於1975年。

sentences.english: If you do, two loyalty counters are removed from that planeswalker.
sentences.chinese: 若你如此做，從該旅法師上移去兩個忠誠度指示物。

sentences.english: Installed with proportional deviation display thermostat, to control temperature accurately.
sentences.chinese: 採用比例式偏差指示溫控器，可精確控制溫度。

sentences.english: Each time a child follows through with a task, he receives a sticker.
sentences.chinese: 每次孩子按照指示做完家務，他都會得到一個貼紙。

sentences.english: "Non-instructive" teaching can firstly be used in literature teaching.
sentences.chinese: “非指示性”教育首先用於文學作品的閱讀欣賞教學。

sentences.english: Status indicators and controls for air-handling systems.
sentences.chinese: 對於空氣處理系統的狀態指示器和控制裝置。

sentences.english: Don't forget to indicate before turning.
sentences.chinese: 拐彎之前別忘記指示車行方向。

sentences.english: The three of us stood in the bathroom eagerly waiting for the telltale line to appear.
sentences.chinese: 我們三個一起站在洗澡間殷切等待儀器指示線的出現。

sentences.english: The manager has been batting around all morning, giving instructions to every department.
sentences.chinese: 經理奔波了一個上午，給各部門下達指示。

sentences.english: The radio's dial twirled and the lights behind the tuning panel went out.
sentences.chinese: 收音機的調諧鈕轉動了一下，面板上的指示燈熄滅了。

sentences.english: The analysis results of the method were compared with those of indicator method.
sentences.chinese: 對該方法與指示劑法分析結果進行了比較。

sentences.english: This measure may indicate problems in the software development process.
sentences.chinese: 這個測量可以指示在軟件開發過程中的問題。

sentences.english: The record store is timestamped to denote the last time it was modified.
sentences.chinese: 記錄存儲被蓋上時間戳來指示它上次被修改的時間。

sentences.english: “No dole, ” he instructed the legislative drafting team.
sentences.chinese: “沒有救濟金，”他這樣指示立法起草小組。

sentences.english: Proceed to entrance of breakwater for orders.
sentences.chinese: 開進防波堤的入口即爲指示。

definition: to transmit down (a chain of command)/to pass down (to lower level)/to issue/to send through
to report/to give an account of/to collect information and report back
to listen and obey/to comply with/to heed/to hearken
to write comments on a report submitted by a subordinate/written comments from a superior
to monitor/to keep a close watch over/surveillance
to conduct/to command/to direct/conductor (of an orchestra)/CL:個|个[ge4]
